titles.title: Let's Protect Our Seniors Act of 1993
To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide for the doubling of the imprisonment penalty for crimes committed against the elderly.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime and Criminal Justice.

bill.summary: 11/10/1993--Introduced. Let's Protect Our Seniors Act of 1993 - Amends the Federal criminal code to provide for the doubling of terms of imprisonment for crimes committed against persons who have attained age 65. Directs the United States Sentencing Commission to amend the sentencing guidelines as necessary to reflect such change.
